location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.The subject 3450 (German War: Interpreters and Political Officers lent to War Office) consists of six volumes, IOR/L/PS/10/506-511. The volumes are divided into fifteen parts, with parts 1, 2 and 3 comprising one volume each, parts 4-5 comprising the fourth volume, parts 6-9 comprising the fifth volume, and parts 10-15 comprising the sixth volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 168; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The volume comprises telegrams, despatches, correspondence, memoranda, and notes relating to civilian officers under the Government of India volunteering for military or naval service during the First World War.Correspondents include officials of the War Office and the India Office.The volume includes a divider which gives the subject number, the year the subject file was opened, the subject heading, and a list of correspondence references by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
